description: From Latin expostulatus, past participle of expostulo (“demand, claim”) from ex- +‎ postulo (“demand”).

verbs.description: expostulate (third-person singular simple present expostulates, present participle expostulating, simple past and past participle expostulated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To protest or remonstrate; to reason earnestly with a person on some impropriety of conduct. [from 16th c.]
